info.title: Amazon MSK (Managed Streaming for Kafka)
info.description: The operations for managing an Amazon MSK cluster.

servers.description: The Kafka endpoint for China (Beijing) and China (Ningxia)
The Kafka endpoint for China (Beijing) and China (Ningxia)

brokerNodeGroupInfo.description: Describes the setup to be used for Kafka broker nodes in the cluster.

allOf.description:
The distribution of broker nodes across Availability Zones. This is an optional parameter. If you don't specify it, Amazon MSK gives it the value DEFAULT. You can also explicitly set this parameter to the value DEFAULT. No other values are currently allowed.

Amazon MSK distributes the broker nodes evenly across the Availability Zones that correspond to the subnets you provide when you create the cluster.

The list of subnets to connect to in the client virtual private cloud (VPC). AWS creates elastic network interfaces inside these subnets. Client applications use elastic network interfaces to produce and consume data. Client subnets can't be in Availability Zone us-east-1e.

The type of Amazon EC2 instances to use for Kafka brokers. The following instance types are allowed: kafka.m5.large, kafka.m5.xlarge, kafka.m5.2xlarge, kafka.m5.4xlarge, kafka.m5.12xlarge, and kafka.m5.24xlarge.

The AWS security groups to associate with the elastic network interfaces in order to specify who can connect to and communicate with the Amazon MSK cluster. If you don't specify a security group, Amazon MSK uses the default security group associated with the VPC.
Contains information about storage volumes attached to MSK broker nodes.
Details for ClientAuthentication using TLS.
Details for ClientAuthentication using SASL.
Contains information about unauthenticated traffic to the cluster.

configurationInfo.description: Specifies the configuration to use for the brokers.

allOf.description: ARN of the configuration to use.
The revision of the configuration to use.

encryptionInfo.description: Includes encryption-related information, such as the AWS KMS key used for encrypting data at rest and whether you want MSK to encrypt your data in transit.

allOf.description: The data-volume encryption details.
The details for encryption in transit.

enhancedMonitoring.description: Specifies which metrics are gathered for the MSK cluster. This property has three possible values: DEFAULT, PER_BROKER, and PER_TOPIC_PER_BROKER. For a list of the metrics associated with each of these three levels of monitoring, see Monitoring.

openMonitoring.description: JMX and Node monitoring for the MSK cluster.

allOf.description: Prometheus settings.

numberOfBrokerNodes.description: The number of broker nodes in the cluster.

get.description: Returns a list of all the MSK clusters in the current Region.

parameters.name: clusterNameFilter
parameters.description: Specify a prefix of the name of the clusters that you want to list. The service lists all the clusters whose names start with this prefix.

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return in the response. If there are more results, the response includes a NextToken parameter.

parameters.name: nextToken
parameters.description: The paginated results marker. When the result of the operation is truncated, the call returns NextToken in the response. To get the next batch, provide this token in your next request.

parameters.name: MaxResults
parameters.description: Pagination limit

parameters.name: NextToken
parameters.description: Pagination token

kafkaVersions.description: The versions of Apache Kafka with which you can use this MSK configuration.

serverProperties.description: Contents of the server.properties file. When using the API, you must ensure that the contents of the file are base64 encoded. When using the AWS Management Console, the SDK, or the AWS CLI, the contents of server.properties can be in plaintext.

get.description: Returns a list of the tags associated with the specified resource.

parameters.name: resourceArn
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies the resource that's associated with the tags.

post.description: Adds tags to the specified MSK resource.

parameters.name: resourceArn
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies the resource that's associated with the tags.

tags.description: The key-value pair for the resource tag.

parameters.name: clusterArn
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the cluster to be updated.

brokerIds.description: The list of broker IDs to be rebooted.

delete.description: Removes the tags associated with the keys that are provided in the query.

parameters.name: resourceArn
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies the resource that's associated with the tags.

parameters.name: tagKeys
parameters.description:
Tag keys must be unique for a given cluster. In addition, the following restrictions apply:

  • Each tag key must be unique. If you add a tag with a key that's already in use, your new tag overwrites the existing key-value pair.

  • You can't start a tag key with aws: because this prefix is reserved for use by AWS. AWS creates tags that begin with this prefix on your behalf, but you can't edit or delete them.

  • Tag keys must be between 1 and 128 Unicode characters in length.

  • Tag keys must consist of the following characters: Unicode letters, digits, white space, and the following special characters: _ . / = + - @.

put.description: Updates the number of broker nodes in the cluster.

parameters.name: clusterArn
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies the cluster.

currentVersion.description: The version of cluster to update from. A successful operation will then generate a new version.

targetNumberOfBrokerNodes.description: The number of broker nodes that you want the cluster to have after this operation completes successfully.

put.description: Updates the EBS storage associated with MSK brokers.

parameters.name: clusterArn
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies the cluster.

currentVersion.description: The version of cluster to update from. A successful operation will then generate a new version.

targetBrokerEBSVolumeInfo.description: Describes the target volume size and the ID of the broker to apply the update to.

put.description: Updates the cluster with the configuration that is specified in the request body.

parameters.name: clusterArn
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies the cluster.

configurationInfo.description: Specifies the configuration to use for the brokers.

The revision of the configuration to use.

currentVersion.description: The version of the cluster that needs to be updated.

put.description: Updates the monitoring settings for the cluster. You can use this operation to specify which Apache Kafka metrics you want Amazon MSK to send to Amazon CloudWatch. You can also specify settings for open monitoring with Prometheus.

parameters.name: clusterArn
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies the cluster.

currentVersion.description: The version of the MSK cluster to update. Cluster versions aren't simple numbers. You can describe an MSK cluster to find its version. When this update operation is successful, it generates a new cluster version.

enhancedMonitoring.description: Specifies which metrics are gathered for the MSK cluster. This property has three possible values: DEFAULT, PER_BROKER, and PER_TOPIC_PER_BROKER. For a list of the metrics associated with each of these three levels of monitoring, see Monitoring.

openMonitoring.description: JMX and Node monitoring for the MSK cluster.

allOf.description: Prometheus settings.

post.description: Associates one or more Scram Secrets with an Amazon MSK cluster.

parameters.name: clusterArn
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the cluster to be updated.

secretArnList.description: List of AWS Secrets Manager secret ARNs.

patch.description: Disassociates one or more Scram Secrets from an Amazon MSK cluster.

parameters.name: clusterArn
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the cluster to be updated.

secretArnList.description: List of AWS Secrets Manager secret ARNs.

BrokerAZDistribution.description:
The distribution of broker nodes across Availability Zones. This is an optional parameter. If you don't specify it, Amazon MSK gives it the value DEFAULT. You can also explicitly set this parameter to the value DEFAULT. No other values are currently allowed.

Amazon MSK distributes the broker nodes evenly across the Availability Zones that correspond to the subnets you provide when you create the cluster.

allOf.description: EBS volume information.

StorageInfo.description: Contains information about storage volumes attached to MSK broker nodes.

allOf.description: List of ACM Certificate Authority ARNs.
Specifies whether you want to enable or disable TLS authentication.
The ARN of the AWS KMS key for encrypting data at rest. If you don't specify a KMS key, MSK creates one for you and uses it.

Indicates the encryption setting for data in transit between clients and brokers. The following are the possible values.

TLS means that client-broker communication is enabled with TLS only.

TLS_PLAINTEXT means that client-broker communication is enabled for both TLS-encrypted, as well as plaintext data.

PLAINTEXT means that client-broker communication is enabled in plaintext only.

The default value is TLS_PLAINTEXT.

When set to true, it indicates that data communication among the broker nodes of the cluster is encrypted. When set to false, the communication happens in plaintext.

The default value is true.

EncryptionInTransit.description: The settings for encrypting data in transit.
